column4: why do people ask a question, then leave before there's time to answer it?
What is the slowest/oldest computer you folks think a default install of ubuntu would run comfortably on?
if you use the 'server' install you can run it on a pentium 133
I was thinking for a newbie's desktop
it's gnome that worries me a bit, I'm used to super-light wm's like fvwm or occassionally flux
right, flux will run on virtually anything.. drop gnome and you're fine
a Linux newbie should learn how to do stuff with the command line anyway.. Gnome is more of a Windows replacement
I don't think I'm going to sell that idea to my technophobic little-old-schoolteacher mom
if she's technofobic then all she cares about is the button to start the browser.. I imagine a nice clean interface like openbox would actually help
the thing is, I will be talking her through installing it herself... I'm hoping for as few steps as humanly possible.
she will have broadband by the time she gets her CD (theoretically)
she has an old 400mhz something with an unknown amount of RAM
you can tell her to do the 'server' install, which should only prompt for a few things, then you ssh in and configure the thing
for the install the trickiest part is the drive partitioning
that sounds good.  I wish I were there to do it for her in person, but that's 2000 miles!
my suggestion -- get her to use something simple like openbox or xfwm4 tops.. she'll have less trouble using it
